summary: This is an FBI Miami Division request to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) and Special Technologies and Applications Office (STAO) for scanning, automation, and data formatting assistance for telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The records are from an address book belonging to Jeffrey Epstein that Rodriguez attempted to sell, which is believed to contain contact information for previously unknown underage victims and Epstein's associates.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein; subject of obstruction of justice case
persons.context: The subject of the FBI's obstruction of justice investigation. He came into possession of an address book belonging to Jeffrey Epstein containing names and numbers of potential underage victims and attempted to sell it rather than turn it over to authorities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: The individual whose former house manager, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed an address book believed to contain contact information for additional underage victims and associates.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez possessed an address book belonging to Epstein containing potential victim information and attempted to sell it, obstructing justice in Epstein's child prostitution case.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager.

events.title: Timeframe for telephone records collection
events.description: Telephone records generated between September 1, 2001, and the present (June 2010) are prioritized for processing in the investigation.

events.title: FBI request for records processing
events.description: FBI Miami submits a formal request to the DocLab and STAO to scan, automate, and format telephone records from the Alfredo Rodriguez obstruction case for incorporation into the Telephone Application (TA) database.

locations: Winchester, Virginia 22602 (Address of FBI DocLab - Telephone Application Audit Processing Team at 170 Marcel Drive)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager and butler, was under FBI investigation for obstruction of justice since October 2009.
Rodriguez possessed an address book belonging to Epstein that contained names and telephone numbers believed to be additional, previously unknown underage victims of Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book to an Undercover Employee (UCE) instead of turning it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas.
The FBI was processing telephone records from the address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims, for the period from September 2001 onward.
The document is a formal FBI request to scan and load these records into the Bureau-wide investigative database called the Telephone Application (TA) for analysis.
